_header: Mine hearts lust star of my comfort
_description: Desire to serve his mistress — one 8-line stanza (with music)

YaleBei91.First Lines:
Myn hertis lust sterre of my confortWith is te guide vn te my
                    parfaite…
YaleBei91.Note:
Not Beinecke Library 9 as listed in Brown  and  Robbins (1943)
XCarleton Fairchild Brown,   and  Rossell Hope Robbins.  
             The Index of Middle English Verse.
         New York: Printed for the Index Society by Columbia University Press,
            1943.

Menner,  Robert J. 
             “Three Fragmentary English Ballades in the Mellon Chansonnier.” 
             Modern Language Quarterly
         6 (1945): 381-7: 384.
